title: Authors and Citation
text: Igelström E, Baxter (2025). SHINEcleaning: Running dashboard cleaning compiling reports SHINE data. R package version 0.3.0, https://scotlandshine.github.io/SHINEcleaning/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {SHINEcleaning: Running a dashboard for the cleaning and compiling of reports from SHINE data},   author = {Erik Igelström and Andy Baxter},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.3.0},   url = {https://scotlandshine.github.io/SHINEcleaning/}, }

what: Running a dashboard for the cleaning and compiling of reports from SHINE data
title: Running a dashboard for the cleaning and compiling of reports from SHINE data
text: tool purpose-built cleaning data Qualtrics-administered SHINE survey primary secondary schools Scotland. can installed R package run Shiny app local remote machine.

title: Running a dashboard for the cleaning and compiling of reports from SHINE data
text: can install ScotlandSHINE repository (user account access) using: Running app R session requires: Alternatively, can ‘clone’ GitHub repository open SHINEcleaning.Rproj new RStudio session. allows access editing files templates. devtools package installed app can run :

title: Running a dashboard for the cleaning and compiling of reports from SHINE data
text: Shiny server way continually running (multiple) shiny apps machine, allowing users access remote shiny app using web browser. handy guide deploying shiny app via shiny server (case using AWS compute instance). can work remotely-accessible Linux machine. run installed package app, first create directory app (e.g. /home/[user]/shinemh) point /etc/shiny-server/shiny-server.conf: ```server { location / { } } SHINEcleaning::run() ``` shiny server location (default port 3838) now running dashboard! See guide walk-throughs instlal/customise .
code: run_as [user]; site_dir /home/[user]/shinemh; log_dir /home/[user]/shinemh/log;  directory_index off; Within this new directory, create an `app.R` file which runs your app:

text: Includes assets. convenience function wraps serveAssets allows easily adding additional remote dependencies (e.g.: CDN) .

title: Data preparation phase — data_prep
text: functions prepare data reshaping generating necessary variables. Helper functions variables included.

title: Data preparation phase — data_prep
code: data_prep(survey_data, report_type = "primary")  who_score(survey_data)  mm_score(survey_data)  sehs_primary(survey_data)  sehs_secondary(survey_data)  asw_score(survey_data)  sdq_score(survey_data)  fas_score(survey_data)

title: Data preparation phase — data_prep
text: survey_data data process report_type type survey data ("primary" "secondary")

title: Data preparation phase — data_prep
text: data_prep: dataframe required variables rendering report score-calculating functions return dataset relevant columns appended: who_score:  5-item wellbeing score (who_score variable) categorical breakdown (who_cat: low/good) mm_score: 'feelings' score primary schools sehs_primary: SEHS score primary schools sehs_secondary: SEHS score secondary schools asw_score: Adolescent sleep-wake score secondary schools sdq_score: SDQ score secondary schools fas_score: family affluence score (0-13)

what: Render a single report for school or local authority — render_report
title: Render a single report for school or local authority — render_report
text: function renders report given data file.

title: Render a single report for school or local authority — render_report
code: render_report(   survey_data,   survey_type,   school_name = NA,   local_authority_name = NA,   cluster_label = NULL,   term = NULL,   number_invited = NULL,   output_location = NULL,   gender_split = TRUE,   classes = NULL,   filename = "primary_report.docx" )

title: Render a single report for school or local authority — render_report
text: survey_data clean dataframe survey results survey_type report type - 'primary'/'secondary' school_name school report, school's name local_authority_name local authority report, LA's name (note compatible school report/name argument) cluster_label Type school grouping, e.g. local authority, primary cluster. used 'local authority' type reports term Name term print report number_invited Number invited complete survey output_location Location file output (defaults working directory) gender_split split report outputs gender classes Vector nested list classes (clustered combinations) filename Name file output
